So we would usually, uh, split the attacks into two parts. non-targeted attacks and targeted attacks.
So non-targeted attacks mean that we just want outputs, we just want to find an adversarial example that is going to fool the model.

These are two different type of attacks that, that are widely discussed in, in the research.

So we have our image in pre-train- in pre-trained network. We have fully access to, to all the parameters and, and the gradients.
So it's probably an easier attack. Right? We can, we can back-propagate all the way

so that we don't have access to its parameters, activations, and, uh, architecture.
